              def add_item
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            66
            

            

                item = Item.find(params[:item_id])
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            66
            

            

                session[:cart] ||= {}
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            66
            

            

                if cart.limit_reached?(item.id)
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            1
            

            

                  flash[:notice] = "You have all the item's inventory in your cart already!"
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

                else
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            65
            

            

                  cart.add_item(item.id.to_s)
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            65
            

            

                  session[:cart] = cart.contents
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            65

              def update_quantity
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            6
            

            

                if params[:change] == "more"
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            1
            

            

                  cart.add_item(params[:item_id])
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            5
            

            

                elsif params[:change] == "less"
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            5
            

            

                  cart.less_item(params[:item_id])
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            5
            

            

                  return remove_item if cart.count_of(params[:item_id]) == 0
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                end

            5

              def subtotal_of(item_id)

    44. 
            83
            

            

                if applicable_discount(item_id).nil? || @contents[item_id.to_s] < applicable_discount(item_id).quantity

              def applicable_discount(item_id)

              def discounted_subtotal_of(item_id)
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            44
            

            

                percent = 1 - (applicable_discount(item_id).percent.to_f / 100)
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            44
            

            

                discounted_price = Item.find(item_id).price * percent
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            44
            

            

                count_of(item_id) * discounted_price.round(2)
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

            
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            1

      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            11
            

            

                (@contents[item_id.to_s] * Item.find(item_id).price) - discounted_subtotal_of(item_id)

    68. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      69.

            class OrderItem < ApplicationRecord

            1
            

            

              def subtotal

    6. 
            118
            

            

                if applicable_discount.nil? || quantity < applicable_discount.quantity

            64
            

            

                  quantity * price

    8. 
            
            

            

                else

              def savings

              end

              def blended_price

                update(price: new_price)

              def fulfill
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            3
            

            

                update(fulfilled: true)
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            3
            

            

                item.update(inventory: item.inventory - quantity)
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

            
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            1
            

            

              def fulfillable?
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            17
            

            

                item.inventory >= quantity
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

            
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            1
            

            

              def applicable_discount
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            326
            

            

                count = quantity
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            326
            

            

                item.active_discounts.where("#{count} >= quantity").order('percent DESC').limit(1).first
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

            
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            1
            

            

              def discounted_subtotal
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            54
            

            

                percent = 1 - (applicable_discount.percent.to_f / 100)
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            54
            

            

                discounted_price = item.price * percent
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            54
            

            

                quantity * discounted_price.round(2)
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

            end

            1
            

            

                  it "I add the minimum quantity of an item for a bulk discount and I see the discount reflected in my subtotal" do
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            1
            

            

                    discount_1 = @megan.discounts.create(percent: 5, quantity: 3)
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            1

    spec/features/items/show_spec.rb

            require 'rails_helper'

            RSpec.describe 'Item Show Page' do
          
      5.

              describe 'As a Visitor' do

                before :each do

            1
            

            

                  @giant = @megan.items.create!(name: 'Giant', description: "I'm a Giant!", price: 50, image: 'https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTaLM_vbg2Rh-mZ-B4t-RSU9AmSfEEq_SN9xPP_qrA2I6Ftq_D9Qw', active: true, inventory: 3 )

    spec/features/merchant/discounts/update_spec.rb

    100.0% lines covered

            require 'rails_helper'

    spec/features/merchant/item_index_spec.rb

    100.0% lines covered

    82 relevant lines. 82 lines covered and 0 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1. 
            1
            

            

            require 'rails_helper'
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            1
            

            

            include ActionView::Helpers::NumberHelper
          
      3.

    4. 
            1
            

            

            RSpec.describe 'Merchant Item Index' do
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            1
            

            

              describe 'As a Merchant employee' do
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            1
            

            

                before :each do
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            6
            

            

                  @merchant_1 = Merchant.create!(name: 'Megans Marmalades', address: '123 Main St', city: 'Denver', state: 'CO', zip: 80218)
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            6
            

            

                  @merchant_2 = Merchant.create!(name: 'Brians Bagels', address: '125 Main St', city: 'Denver', state: 'CO', zip: 80218)
          
      9.

    spec/features/merchants/index_spec.rb

    100.0% lines covered

            require 'rails_helper'
          
      2.

            1

    spec/spec_helper.rb

            # This file was generated by the `rails generate rspec:install` command. Conventionally, all
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            
            

            

            # specs live under a `spec` directory, which RSpec adds to the `$LOAD_PATH`.
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            
            

            

            # The generated `.rspec` file contains `--require spec_helper` which will cause
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
            

            

            # this file to always be loaded, without a need to explicitly require it in any
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
            

            

            # files.
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

            # Given that it is always loaded, you are encouraged to keep this file as
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

            # light-weight as possible. Requiring heavyweight dependencies from this file
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

            # will add to the boot time of your test suite on EVERY test run, even for an
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

            # individual file that may not need all of that loaded. Instead, consider making
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

            # a separate helper file that requires the additional dependencies and performs
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

            # the additional setup, and require it from the spec files that actually need
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

            # it.
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

            # See http://rubydoc.info/gems/rspec-core/RSpec/Core/Configuration
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            1
            

            

            RSpec.configure do |config|

              config.expect_with :rspec do |expectations|
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                # This option will default to `true` in RSpec 4. It makes the `description`
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                # and `failure_message` of custom matchers include text for helper methods
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                # defined using `chain`, e.g.:
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

                #     be_bigger_than(2).and_smaller_than(4).description
          
      25.

                #     # => "be bigger than 2 and smaller than 4"
          
      26.

                # ...rather than:

              # This option will default to `:apply_to_host_groups` in RSpec 4 (and will
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

              # have no way to turn it off -- the option exists only for backwards
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

              # compatibility in RSpec 3). It causes shared context metadata to be
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

              # inherited by the metadata hash of host groups and examples, rather than
          
      44.

      45.

            1
            

            

              config.shared_context_metadata_behavior = :apply_to_host_groups
          
      46.

            # The settings below are suggested to provide a good initial experience

            # with RSpec, but feel free to customize to your heart's content.
          
      49.

            =begin
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

              # This allows you to limit a spec run to individual examples or groups
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

              # you care about by tagging them with `:focus` metadata. When nothing
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

              # is tagged with `:focus`, all examples get run. RSpec also provides
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

              # aliases for `it`, `describe`, and `context` that include `:focus`
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

              # metadata: `fit`, `fdescribe` and `fcontext`, respectively.
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

              config.filter_run_when_matching :focus
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

            
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

              # Allows RSpec to persist some state between runs in order to support
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

              # the `--only-failures` and `--next-failure` CLI options. We recommend
          
      59.

              # you configure your source control system to ignore this file.
          
      60.

              # Limits the available syntax to the non-monkey patched syntax that is

              # Print the 10 slowest examples and example groups at the

              # Run specs in random order to surface order dependencies. If you find an
          
      85.

              # order dependency and want to debug it, you can fix the order by providing

              # Seed global randomization in this process using the `--seed` CLI option.
          
      91.

              # Setting this allows you to use `--seed` to deterministically reproduce
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

              # test failures related to randomization by passing the same `--seed` value
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

              # as the one that triggered the failure.
          
      94.

              Kernel.srand config.seed
          
      95.

            end
          
      97.
